conference: The International Conference for High Performance Computing, Networking, Storage and Analysis
notes: Members of the TPC are limited to at most three submissions. Area chairs are limited to one, not in their area. Co-chairs may not submit papers. In the first round (pre-rebuttal), each paper is assigned to four reviewers, but no more than 10 papers per reviewer (http://sc17.supercomputing.org/program/papers-review-and-submission/). Each PC member is then expected to write another two reviews (on average) for the second round, for ambiguous papers. Some papers may have shepherding after that. In order to be considered for best paper, the authors must submit an artifact description appendix, as part of the reproducibility initiative. This initiative (http://sc17.supercomputing.org/2017/02/07/submitting-a-technical-paper-to-sc17-participate-in-the-sc17-reproducibility-initiative/) allows for a short artifact description appendix or computational results analysis appendix for 'boutique environments'. It doesn't require that the software be open-sources, but to be eligible for the ACM Artifacts Available badge, the software must be downloadable without restriction. (http://sc17.supercomputing.org/program/technical-papers/reproducibility-initiatives-for-technical-papers/reproducibility-initiative-author-faq/). There's even a Student Cluster Competition where students will attempt to replicate the results of papers with these appendices. 45% of submissions included a reproducibility appendix (51% of accepted papers). Also, 20 submission had a computational results analysis appendix. The TPC is divided into nine areas: http://sc17.supercomputing.org/sc-17-planning-committee/.
